nl.sense_os.platform

Class SensePlatform

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.sense_os.platform.SensePlatform

  • public class SensePlatform
extends java.lang.Object
    A proxy class that acts as a high-level interface to the sense Android library. By instantiating this class you bind (and start if needed) the sense service. You can then use the high level methods of this class, and/or get the service object to work directly with the sense service.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addDataPoint

        public boolean addDataPoint(java.lang.String sensorName,
                   java.lang.String displayName,
                   java.lang.String description,
                   java.lang.String dataType,
                   java.lang.Object value,
                   long timestamp)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Convenience method to add a data point without specifying the device UUID
        Parameters:
        sensorName - Name of the sensor
        displayName - Display name of the sensor
        description - Description of the sensor, i.e. CommonSense "device_type"
        dataType - Data type, e.g. json, string, float, bool
        value - Data point value
        timestamp - Data point time stamp
        Returns:
        true if the data point was sent to the Sense service
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        See Also:
        #addDataPoint(String, String, String, String, String, String, long)

      • addDataPoint

        public boolean addDataPoint(java.lang.String sensorName,
                   java.lang.String displayName,
                   java.lang.String description,
                   java.lang.String dataType,
                   java.lang.String deviceUuid,
                   java.lang.Object value,
                   long timestamp)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a data point for a sensor at CommonSense. If the sensor does not exist yet, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        sensorName - Name of the sensor
        displayName - Display name of the sensor
        description - Description of the sensor, i.e. CommonSense "device_type"
        dataType - Data type, e.g. json, string, float, bool
        deviceUuid - (Optional) Device UUID, set null to make sure the sensor is connected to the current device
        value - Data point value
        timestamp - Data point time stamp
        Returns:
        true if the data point was sent to the Sense service
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the service connection to the Sense service and cleans up the binding.

      • flushData

        public boolean flushData()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Flush data to CommonSense
        Returns:
        true if the flush task was successfully started
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet

      • flushDataAndBlock

        public void flushDataAndBlock()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Flush data to Common Sense, return after the flush is completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet

      • getContext

        public android.content.Context getContext()

      • getData

        public org.json.JSONArray getData(java.lang.String sensorName,
                         boolean onlyFromDevice)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                  org.json.JSONException
        Retrieve a number of values of a sensor from CommonSense.
        Parameters:
        sensorName - The name of the sensor to get data from
        onlyFromDevice - Whether or not to only look through sensors that are part of this device. Searches all sensors, including those of this device, if set to NO
        Returns:
        JSONArray of data points
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        org.json.JSONException - If the response from CommonSense could not be parsed

      • getData

        public org.json.JSONArray getData(java.lang.String sensorName,
                         boolean onlyFromDevice,
                         int limit)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                  org.json.JSONException
        Retrieve a number of values of a sensor from CommonSense.
        Parameters:
        sensorName - The name of the sensor to get data from
        onlyFromDevice - Whether or not to only look through sensors that are part of this device. Searches all sensors, including those of this device, if set to NO
        limit - Maximum amount of data points.
        Returns:
        JSONArray of data points
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        org.json.JSONException - If the response from CommonSense could not be parsed

        public org.json.JSONArray getLocalData(java.lang.String sensorName)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       org.json.JSONException
        Retrieve a number of values of a sensor from the local storage.
        Parameters:
        sensorName - The name of the sensor to get data from
        onlyFromDevice - Whether or not to only look through sensors that are part of this device. Searches all sensors, including those of this device, if set to NO
        Returns:
        JSONArray of data points
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        org.json.JSONException - If the response from CommonSense could not be parsed

        public org.json.JSONArray getLocalData(java.lang.String sensorName,
                              int limit)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       org.json.JSONException
        Retrieve a number of values of a sensor from the local storage.

        limit - Maximum amount of data points.
        Returns:
        JSONArray of data points
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        org.json.JSONException - If the response from CommonSense could not be parsed

      • getNewDataAction

        public java.lang.String getNewDataAction()
        Returns:
        The intent action for new sensor data. This can be used to subscribe to new data.

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String user,
         java.lang.String password,
         ISenseServiceCallback callback)
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  android.os.RemoteException
        Tries to log in at CommonSense using the supplied username and password. After login, the service remembers the username and password.
        Parameters:
        username - Username for login
        pass - Hashed password for login
        callback - Interface to receive callback when login is completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Sense service is not bound yet
        android.os.RemoteException

      • logout

        public void logout()
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   android.os.RemoteException
        Logs out a user, destroying his or her records.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        android.os.RemoteException

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password,
                java.lang.String email,
                java.lang.String address,
                java.lang.String zipCode,
                java.lang.String country,
                java.lang.String firstName,
                java.lang.String surname,
                java.lang.String mobileNumber,
                ISenseServiceCallback callback)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         android.os.RemoteException
        Registers a new user at CommonSense and logs in immediately.
        Parameters:
        username - Username for the new user
        password - Hashed password String for the new user
        email - Email address
        address - Street address (optional, null if not required)
        zipCode - ZIP code (optional, null if not required)
        country - Country
        firstName - First name (optional, null if not required)
        surname - Surname (optional, null if not required)
        mobileNumber - Phone number, preferably in E164 format (optional, null if not required)
        callback - Interface to receive callback when login is completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        android.os.RemoteException
